titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3590) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the increase in the income threshold used in determining the deduction for medical care.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3590) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the increase in the income threshold used in determining the deduction for medical care.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-741, by Mr. Burgess.
The resolution provides that the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 141.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 858.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 858, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 858 and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 237 - 171 (Roll no. 500).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 239 - 169 (Roll no. 501).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3590) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the increase in the income threshold used in determining the deduction for medical care.
